page.title: 19Employment.
page.content: Employment in the Midsomer Norton/Radstock areas has changed a great deal since the decline of the Somerset coalfield in the 50s & 60s. Fifty years agop the major employer in the area was the coal mining industry & farming where many people were employed before mechanization. Since the decline of the pits other industries have moved into the area,the most important one being printing & associated trades. The largest printing factories in the area are Purnells(at Paulton), Mardon Flexible, Standard Check Book and Welton Bag. Other people are employed in small light industry,banks, offices and a large selection of shops in the high street. Other employers are shoe manufacturers,the local athority and the usual service industries.
